page.title: 18TRANSPORT
page.content: The transport on Canna consists of 2 landrovers, 2 tractors and 1 van. The roads on Canna are private so vehicles do not need to have tax or M.O.T. Canna is connected to the mainland by a passenger ferry called the Lochmor which sails from Mallaig run by Caledonian Macbraynes. This ferry runs 4 times a week in the winter and 5 times a week in the summer because then the ferry comes twice on a Saturday. As well as being the only means of transport on and off the island the ferry is very important to the community because it brings the post and food ordered from shops in Mallaig or further afield. Islanders have to pay freight according to weight on items carried on the ferry.
